narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: Well prepared slides with great lectures to go with

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?

comments: I liked the lecture based materials with take home tests. It made me go through my notes and the topics, re-learning some of the material, but the information was clearly laid out for me.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: Alan is always available for questions.

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: The only assignments were the take home exams

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: Interesting take home exams that force you to think about the information given.

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: Although not incredibly useful to theatre production work, seeing different theatres and ways of approaching the same problem with diffrent outcomes is useful.

It was a topic that I was interested in and enjoyed, but it doesn't have a direct application to much production work. The audience-stage relationship or the facilities that the theater has is relevant, but that is very dependent on each individual space one works in.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Alan has an incredible depth of knowledge in this topic.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: The Ex was a noisy room to have class in. Many people passing through, and noise coming down from the lobby.
The ex is basically a hallway so that make concentrating difficult sometimes. I wish the PowerPoints on the server were updated to have the ones shown in class.
I really liked 1782 day with the historical artifacts, giving us hands on historical context.
The classroom was not very good, I felt my attention would have been better captured in a better room.
